Post._content:
> CPUOSCACHE

## 1. 


 CPU 



[](https://gist.github.com/hellerbarde/2843375)[](https://people.eecs.berkeley.edu/~rcs/research/interactive_latency.html)

## 2. 

 CPU  2.6G 2.6*10^9  0.38ns 3.0G+ 1s 1s 

 0.5ns 1.3s CPU locality cache 

 5ns 13s[stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/11227809/why-is-it-faster-to-process-a-sorted-array-than-an-unsorted-array)

 7ns 18.2s

> :
 CPU [](https://fgiesen.wordpress.com/2016/08/07/why-do-cpus-have-multiple-cache-levels/)

 25ns 65s

 100ns 260s42-3CPU [](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Von_Neumann_architecture#Von_Neumann_bottleneck)

 CPU  1500ns 1.5us[](http://blog.tsunanet.net/2010/11/how-long-does-it-take-to-make-context.html) CPU  65 CPU 

 1Gbps  2K  20us 14.4 CPU 

SSD  150us 4.5SSD CPU  SSD  CPU I/O  IO  memcached  redis 

 1MB  250us 7.5

 0.5ms 15 CPU 

 SSD  1MB  1ms 1 SSD CPU SSD 

 10ms 10 CPU  RPM(Revolutions Per Minute/) RPM 

 1MB  20ms 20IO 

 150ms ping  12.5CDN 

 4s  3 Mac  CPU 

 5min 255  CPU 


## 3. 

- [What Every Programmer Should Know About Memory](https://www.akkadia.org/drepper/cpumemory.pdf)

- [Getting Physical With Memory](http://duartes.org/gustavo/blog/post/getting-physical-with-memory/)

Post.title: linux()
Post._content:
## Linux #### (PCB) task_strcut ```cpp task_struct { pid ... *mm *fs *files *signal } ``` task_struct Linuxpid`cat /proc/sys/kernel/pid_max` Fork`:(){:|:&};:` #### task_structtask_structlinux pid #### linux
![](https://github.com/howar-luo/image_repo/blob/master/task_life.png?raw=true)
## #### forkwaitwaitpid (init)exit()(Zombie) exit()psZpsinitinit #### ,,,(the process ID,the termination status of the process,the amount of CPU time taken by the process)wait/waitpidwait/waitpid. #### kill + + ## cpu STOP`ctrl+z``gdb attach` `ctrl+z` ## > pagefaultlinuxsignalsignalpagefault...... ## fork ``` main() { fork(); printf("hello\r\n"); fork(); printf("hello\r\n"); while(1); } ``` `hello`6 fork

Post.title: Makefile
Post._content:
## 1. makefile
  Makefile

### 1.1 
  Makefile

	main.o : main.c defs.h
		cc -c main.c

  

### 1.2 
  GNUmake[.o]make

  make[.o][.c]makewhatever.owhatever.cwhatever.o cc -c whatever.c makefilemakefile

  makefile

	objects = main.o kbd.o command.o display.o insert.o search.o files.o utils.o
	
	edit : $(objects)
		cc -o edit $(objects)

	main.o : defs.h
	kbd.o : defs.h command.h
	command.o : defs.h command.h
	display.o : defs.h buffer.h
	insert.o : defs.h buffer.h
	search.o : defs.h buffer.h
	files.o : defs.h buffer.h command.h
	utils.o : defs.h

### 1.3 
  objects

  Makefile

  ****a:=bba
	
		var1:=$(var2) bar
		var2:=foo
  var1"bar"

  ****a=bC++javaba

		var1=$(var2) bar
		var2:=foo

  var1"foo bar"

  ****a?=baa=b 

  ****a+=bbaa

		var1=func1.o func2.0
		var2+=$(var1) func3.o

  var2"func1.o func2.o func3.o"
### 1.4 
  

  a. makefilemakefilecinclude

  b. MakefileC#if

  c. 

### 1.5 
  MakefileUNIXShell#C/C++//Makefile#/#
